original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Men's 2024 Future Tours Program of Sri Lanka Cricket was announced on Wednesday (29).
The Sri Lanka National Team will commence its 2024 international cricket calendar with a home series against Zimbabwe in January, which will consist of three ODIs and three T20i series.
It would be followed by a series against Afghanistan during the January–February period, consisting of one test match, three ODIs, and three T20Is.
Then, the Sri Lanka national team will head to Bangladesh for an allformat tour before heading to the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024, which will be played in West Indies and USA.
India, New Zealand, and the West Indies are also expected to arrive in the country for tours under the FTP during 2024.
The National Team will play England in a three match test series in England during mid-year, while the 2024 season will end with tours to South Africa and New Zealand.
